result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas M Stahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Write minimum 300 word apology to mother and Door County Sheriff's Dept.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Door County Restitution Summary

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 4, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 4, 5. Count 3 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case is close to resolution, needs to speak with DA about 2 issues, requests status/possible plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Change of Attorney

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to Suppress. Defense/State advise of issues. Testimony taken. Exhibit 1 - Photo of garage - offered and rec'd. Defense/State present arguments. Defense presents rebuttal argument. Court makes statement, denies motion. Court questions what to schedule next. Defense makes statement regarding report of Dr. who didn't review medical records before writing report, will have to hire someone, encourages State to make offer. State advises of offer that was rejected by Defense.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 9, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Michael Galli, Ph.D.
to suppress evidence discovered from illegally obtained statements
Phone call from Dr. Galli.  He has met with Defendant, is waiting for medical records, hopes to have report out in the next few days.

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to suppress statements. Defense advises that parties agree regarding what statements should be suppressed, advises of disagreement regarding search of garage and seizure, questions whether Court would like separate motion on that issue.  State advises that officers present now are not officers needed for that issue, advises of details of agreement. Discussion regarding whether testimony is required for remaining issue. Court will wait to see motion, suggestion as to how motion should be handled.
to Suppress Statements
Motion hearing on May 28, 2014 at 09:45 am.
for Examination under Sec. 971.16
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty/NGI pleas. Discussion regarding examiners.  Defense to advise by Tuesday.
by State

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek. Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Lucas M Stahl in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Set prelim.  Bond continues as is.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Take all prescription as prescribed. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Lucas M Stahl appeared by video conference.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/31/14, 10:00.
